resources.string: You are now connected to Wi-Fi Network Name Wi-Fi Network
When you see this symbol at the top of your screen after connected to a Wi-Fi network, you are able to make calls and send messages over Wi-Fi.
Use Wi-Fi for calls. If Wi-Fi is unavailable, use cellular network.(Default)
Use cellular network for calls. If cellular network is unavailable use Wi-Fi.
Use only Wi-Fi for calls. Do not use Cellular network, even if available.
Cellular preferred is your connection preference

Wi-Fi calling lets you say goodbye to spotty coverage. With Wi-Fi calling you can send and receive calls and messages over a Wi-Fi network using your existing T-Mobile plan. There\'s no special setup needed for Wi-Fi calling. From the settings menu, go to Wireless and Networks and connect to a Wi-Fi network to get started.
Once you see the Wi-Fi calling icon in the status bar, your phone is ready for Wi-Fi calling.
To stay on a Wi-Fi call, remain in the range of the Wi-Fi network. You\'ll get an audible beep and a screen message letting you know when a call has dropped because you have moved out of range.
Important Notice\nYour SIM card needs to be updated for Wi-Fi Calling service compatibility. Please visit a T-Mobile store or dial 611 from your phone to reach Customer Care.
Insufficient bandwidth, downgrade to voice call

LEARN ALL ABOUT WI-FI CALLING

Wi-Fi calling lets you say goodbye to spotty coverage. With Wi-Fi calling you can send and receive calls and messages over a Wi-Fi network using your existing T-Mobile plan. There\'s no special setup needed for Wi-Fi calling. From the settings menu, go to Wireless and Networks and connect to a Wi-Fi network to get started.

LEARN ALL ABOUT WI-FI CALLING

Once you see the Wi-Fi calling icon in the status bar, your phone is ready for Wi-Fi calling.

To stay on a Wi-Fi call, remain in the range of the Wi-Fi network. You\'ll get an audible beep and a screen message letting you know when a call has dropped because you have moved out of range.

What is Wi-Fi Calling\?

Wi-Fi Calling lets you make and receive voice calls and text\/text/multimedia messages over Wi-Fi when your phone is connected to a Wi-Fi network and registered with the T-Mobile network for Wi-Fi Calling.

How do I enable Wi-Fi\?

To enable Wi-Fi, use the wireless control section of your Android settings menu.

How do I enable Wi-Fi Calling\?

By default, your phone is enabled for Wi-Fi Calling as soon as you enable the Wi-Fi radio. Wi-Fi Calling can be controlled from the Wi-Fi Calling Settings.

How do I know when I am using Wi-Fi for my calls\?

When your phone associates with a Wi-Fi network, it will automatically try to register with the T-Mobile network for Wi-Fi Calling. Once the registration has successfully completed you will see the Wi-Fi Calling icon in the Status Bar. You will also see the Wi-Fi Calling icon displayed in the dialer (in place of your regular calling icon) and you will briefly see a message at the top of the screen saying, \"Calls will be made over Wi-Fi.\"

Will calls or SMS\/MMS over Wi-Fi be charged differently than my cellular calls\?

The primary benefit of Wi-Fi Calling is to increase your coverage in locations with Wi-Fi. Calls and messages made over Wi-Fi will be charged like cellular calls for certain plans.

What happens if I lose Wi-Fi coverage\?

If you have access to the LTE network and your device is VoLTE enabled, your call will seamlessly transition the TMobile LTE network. However, if you do not have LTE or other cellular network access, any active call will drop. You will receive a notification if your call drops due to a loss of Wi-Fi coverage.
Please do not show me again
When you see this symbol at the top of your screen, you are able to make calls and send messages over Wi-Fi. Wi-Fi calling may use minutes with certain plans.
Congratulations, you\'ve complete your first call using Wi-Fi calling.
Allowed all devices without verifying MAC addresses
No devices are added this time

Wi-Fi MAC address is typically available from the device settings.For instance Android devices have information on \'Settings - about Phone - Status - Wi-Fi MAC adddress\'.\n\n if you can\'t find MAC address of the device, you may turn on \'Allow all devices\' option and connect the device. After it is connected you may turn off \'Allow all devices\' option and you will be given a menu to add all the connected devices to the list without entering MAC address manually.
You do not have any device in the allowed device list. Inorder to turn off this option, you must add one or more device in the list.
Do you want to add all the currently connected devices to the allowed device list?\n\n You may delete each device from the list afterward.
Adding new allowed device failed. Please try again.
